719047f.text:
Columbia Street, east side, north from but not including Grand Street.
April 1, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
719047f.folder: Columbia Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

719045f-a.text:
(1)
Columbia Street, west side, north from but not including Grand Street,
to and including Broome Street.
April 4, 1928.
P. L Sperr.
(2)
A more extensive view northward. Note the Williamsburg Bridge at Delancey Street. The buildings shown in the foreground have been demolished
and replaced by a modern apartment house.
April 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
719045f-a.folder: Columbia Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

719044f-a.text:
Columbia Street, west side, north from but not including Grand, to but not including Broome Streets. Also shown (right) is Broome Street, north side, west from but not including Columbia, to but not including Willett Streets. Acroas the construction appears Sheriff Street, west side, north from but not including Grand, to and including Broome Streets. Building being erected on the former site of the R. Hoe and Company Printing Machine Manufacturers, will be a model slum clearance apartment house, sponsered by Governor Lehman.
June 1, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
719044f-a.folder: Columbia Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

720128f-b.text:
(1)
522-534 Grand Street, at, adjoining, and east of the N.E. corner of Columbia Street. Nos. 522-530 are all frame houses with brick
fronts.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 299.
(2)
The same, showing a closer view of frame houses.
July 22, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
720128f-b.folder: Grand Street & Columbia Street, Manhattan, NY

720128f-a.text:
(1)
522-534 Grand Street, at, adjoining, and east of the N.E. corner of Columbia Street. Nos. 522-530 are all frame houses with brick
fronts.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 299.
(2)
The same, showing a closer view of frame houses.

P. L. Sperr.
720128f-a.folder: Grand Street & Columbia Street, Manhattan, NY

720134f-a.text:
Grand Street, north sido, east from Columbia Street to East River. Note the 4 hip-roofed houses (Nos. 324-530) that are just east of the 4-story building (No. 522) at the corner. These buildings are of frame construction with brick fronts. Pictures,slightly later,show No. 524 improved.
April 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
720134f-a.folder: Grand Street & Columbia Street, Manhattan, NY
